comment: I would rate him a 0 if I could. Absolutely so rude and unprofessional. Don't even bother asking him questions because he will make you feel stupid. Posts things on brightspace with wrong or confusing information but won't answer questions about it when asked. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
terrible...💔
actually terrible professor, he is so off and on with students. so mean, tells everyone to shut up every 5 seconds.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I would give him a zero if I could. He makes disrespectful comments towards his students for asking him questions about the content. He takes weeks to input grades and he is not motivating. There have been several times he has not shown up to his own office hours. It takes him 4 tries to correctly answer his own practice questions. Do not take him.

AMAZING. Had him for Lab and failed my lecture and retook him for lecture. He gives all opportunities to do good. He is rough around the edges but go to office hours and he will help you (but mainly make you apply yourself) test corrections for points, reading notes and hw for completion, open note quizzes. great

Took him for orgo1, honestly wasn't that bad.There's 4 exams, he allows cheat sheets to be use, even on the final exam. He gives extra credit after completing test corrections. Gives you the whole semester to get HW done. In-class quizzes once a week,he allows you to use your notes/friends. I would recommend him! he sounds rude,but he's pretty chil

took him for orgo 1 and 2 lab got an A in both. lets you use your iPad as a lab notebook which makes doing the notebook so much easier. one free late turn in.  gets behind at the end of semester and starts putting in 100s. 5 question pre-lab quiz start of lab which is usually just from first page of handout. easy A

Honestly Bannin was very helpful. He would show grace when necessary. Stayed after to help with any questions  & extended his office hours for me when I had a late class but needed help. Granted his sarcasm and tone can come off "rude" but i didn't mind. It was funny to me. I would DEFINITELY recommend for lab. Didn't take his lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly I recommend him for lab, he is pretty clear with instructions. It might take sometime getting used to him but if you do your best he recognizes that. Most assignments are graded for completion (plays music during labs)

I took him for Ochem 1 and he really is a great professor. He provides the material and mechanisms needed, explains it, shows how to apply it. The tests are similar to the lectures, but more in depth. Studying is required. Attend office hours, and he allows a cheat sheet. Would take him again. 4 exams, lowest replaced by the average of the 4 tests

I took him for OCHEM 1 and I liked the way he taught so I took him for OCHEM 2. There are 4 tests and the lowest gets replaced by the average and he does do test corrections where you can get back 30% of the points that you missed. If after the last test you have an A in the class then you can exempt the final. He also offers cheat sheets on tests.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I found him to be rude. whenever i had a question i would feel stupid for even asking it. he goes quickly in class and relies on the reading notes to help teach us. he doesn't do many examples in class, and his tests are super difficult. the tests don't match what's on the study guide. only good part is that reading and homework is for completion.

Moves very quickly in lecture and only shows a few examples (about one or two) when explaining the material. Gives out homework and grades for completion. Requires you to come prepared to class by reading and taking Cornell notes on the chapters he assigns. A quiz once a week and allows cheat sheet on exams. Very difficult to understand DO NOT TAKE

Had for lab. Doesnt grade anything til end of semester..so everyone gets a 100. Intimidating at first bc he doesnt like to answer questions but once you learn he is just a sarcastic dude it doesnt bother you as much. Make sure to review techniques if they are techniques learned in ogro 1.

Honestly was pleasantly surprised because I was expecting a very harsh teacher. He records all his lectures and uploads it so you can rewatch (helpful since I took it over the summer aka 5-hour lectures). His homework is for completion and allows a cheatsheet for exams. Pretty understanding. Hard exams but that's organic chemistry lol

The course is tough and heavy with information, especially if taking it during the summer, but Bannin is helpful during office hours. He provides plenty of resources and I re-watched the lectures and did the practice exams and problems he gave and it helped a bunch. He was accommodating with my work schedule and was always helpful in explaining
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Always come prepared to lab for pre lecture discussion. Snarky/blunt personality don't take it personally. Slow-ish grader but ends up giving a 100 for lab reports and worksheets. He doesn't write lab final and it was open note. Decent at explaining topics and plays good music. Very hands off during lab unless you need something from him.

Can come off as rude since he is really blunt. Would get snarky when students would ask questions about the experiment. I do not recommend him for lecture but he is decent for lab. Only bad thing is that the final is really hard and lowers your grade due to its weighted amount. Most things are for completion. Put in the effort and you'll be good.

Dr. Bannin is not as bad as a lot of these reviews say. Everything is a completion grade and it is really not that much work. He is very judgy so make sure you have tough skin. He is a cool guy, but he expects you to know everything about organic chemistry.

He doesn’t care about his students. I reached out to him multiple times to get help in this course and he never emailed me back for an appointment. No SI sessions/leader for his class, so be prepared to learn everything on your own. His lectures aren’t structured and it’s easy to get lost during class time.

IDC about any of the positive reviews. Took him in 2020 so this is long overdue. EVERYONE cringes at the mention of his name. He does not care about anything but making Ochem harder than what it has to be. he came to school sick; he couldnt even explain a concept that we had to learn. IDK why he still has a job! AVOID HIM. retook w/ TAPU & got a B!

I can't say I agree with all the negative reviews. Keep in mind. It is a hard class. Regardless of who is teaching. If you want to actually grasp the material, Dr. B is a very good choice. If you don't care, he doesn't care, plain and simple. Participate in class, do the homework and ask questions. You'll get out what you put in for this class.

Bannin makes lab unnecessarily hard. If you ask him questions he'll make you feel stupid. He takes forever to grade any assignments and will fail you on the final. He creeped on some of the girls in lab too. 0/10 take anyone else if you value your grade.

Goes off topic during lectures. Makes MULTIPLE mistakes during lectures, backtracks far too many times to be consistent, confused himself while he teaches, every single test we took had errors on his part.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I do not know why he has a 2.4. He should have less than a 1 on this website. He is rude and does not know how to treat you like a human. If you ask him questions he will treat you like you are illiterate and stupid. His tests are impossible. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I do not know how he got hired.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I have a 75 in the class. This is a very tough class. You are honestly better off taking o chem 1 and 2 with Tapu. Dont risk your gpa. This class is just very tough. I attended all three si sessions per week and every single office hours. He is an average teacher. The tests still are hard. I would have a 72 if he didnt curve tests by 3 points.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: i took bannin for lab in the summer semester and it was a breeze! he was very straightforward with what he wanted, didnt grade too harshly (some assignments were graded for completion) and he made lab very fun to me by sharing stories and interacting with students about things other than chemistry. final exam was tough thats the only downfall.

I had to drop since he gave me a zero for having technical difficulties on his first exam (he had ridiculous specific requirements) . He was extremely rude when I told him the problems I was having and said it was a failure on my part. DO NOT RECOMMEND

A solid choice for lab. He can be passive-aggresive sometimes and tends to get mad/irritated easily. I enjoyed his pre lab lectures; he explained most concepts well. He usually helped when we were stuck however, he did expect us to know procedures from 3361L. If we didn't know, too bad so sad. Otherwise, expect to not know your grade until the end.

Did not curve any exams. Did not curve final. Anytime a question was asked he replied in an unprofessional manner as if we were supposed to have known the answer already. Our final had questions that did not pertain to the semester we had just taken and many students did not pass the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The class was only easy because he waited until the last minute to put in grades and just gave everyone a 100 for everything. He didnt prepare us for the final at all and many people failed it as a result. He is extremely rude and acts very unprofessionally. Tried to blame me for breaking something. Wouldn't take him again

I am so surprised by reading all the negative comments. He is very cool and laid back. He is very patient with our mistakes in lab and helps us to fix it if we mess up the procedure. He plays music which makes lab more fun. I like his prelab lectures, very informative. I am learning new material in his class as well. Highly recommended!

He was one of the worst teachers Ive had. He is very monotoned and was not very enthusiastic about teaching. His quizzes and tests were also graded weirdly. His final was also terrible. Half the class did not pass his final and he did not curve it which brought my gpa down. I would not take his class again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: For lab, he didnt put grades in until the end of the semester. Labs werent hard as long as you followed the instructions. Hes pretty laid back. Hell play music in the background and is open to making conversation with students. I did one week online & the next in person and so on.

Weekly quizzes, but he gave up on them in the final few weeks. Average score of the 13 quizzes replaces the lowest three. Average score of the 4 exams replaces the lowest. Monotone at times. Became different, but better online at the end of the semester. Read the book for a better understanding. Lectures are a good visual. Explains material well.

He really does not care about you as a student and just seems like he hates his job. It's a really hard class and would be nice to have someone who cares enough to explain things in a way that makes sense and not like he's talking to someone who has already learned it.

probably the worst professor I've ever had in all four years of college. not only is he rude, but he makes it apparent that he doesn't care about the success of his students. if you have no other choice but to take bannin - take a gap semester. you don't want to tank your gpa with this course. that's how bad he is

OCHEM is already a hard class, but Bannin makes it so much worse than it needs to be. I knew coming into this course from other reviews he might not be the best professor, but he proved to be worse. He is unnecessarily rude when in correspondence and snaps when you asks questions in lecture. Makes students feel dumb for not knowing the content.

Second time taking chem 2 but passed this time. He does quizzes everyday you attend class. Tests are not weighted as heavy as homework and classwork. So if you are not a good test taker, take him. Passed with a B even though I failed like 3 tests. Does give extra credit at the end. He is a little rude at times and expects you to remember everything
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Quiz once a week. However, the quizzes are easy, ONLY IF YOU PAY ATTENTION during pre-lab lecture the previous weeks. Very lax personality yet professional. Tough grader but his rubrics for papers are clear on what he wants to see. You may need to do some self-research/studying though. But its ochem, only a handful of profs that can teach it well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: He doesn't know the labs/procedures. He gives incorrect answers all the time, which makes it really hard to learn. He is not approachable and will not answer questions that are asked, and he will act like you are stupid. He literally has no idea what he's doing. Unnecessarily hard quizzes every class and the final is all free response.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
